abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Telecommunications Project in Western
            Samoa. The main objective of the project was to finance
            priority investments to upgrade the telecommunications
            networks, build a basis for its future expansion, and lay
            the groundwork for the development of rural
            telecommunications. The project would also assist the
            Government by formulating and implementing modifications in
            the institutional, policy and regulatory environment for
            telecommunications; and strengthen PTD's project
            implementation and operations and maintenance (O&M)
            capacities by strengthening and training its human
            resources. The Project met its main development objective to
            upgrade and expand the country's telecommunications
            network and to build a basis for future expansion, also
            laying ground for the development of rural
            telecommunications. Eventually, this objective was met
            beyond original targets, together with the
            rehabilitation/replacement and upgrading of installations
            destroyed or damaged by two cyclones during the project
            period. These actions could be combined through adequate
            adjustments to the on-going actions and works under the
            project, also benefitting from the cooperation between the
            main cofinancing agencies and the beneficiary, and from the
            arrangements for project implementation. By ceding project
            administration to the ADB, the main cofinancier under the
            project, IDA intended to obtain some operational
            simplification and resource savings, and also prevent
            duplication of activities in the implementation of a
            relatively small project for utilities type infrastructure,
            in a very distant location.
